themes: Need for long-term, affordable creative space
Insufficient institutional and city support for cultural producers
Importance of funding infrastructure over events
Integration of non-arts funding streams into cultural work
Amplification and marketing of existing cultural work
Sustainability and stability for artists and cultural workers
key_phrases: we’re already doing that, often with limited resources and little institutional support
the City to step up and create the conditions that allow artists, organizers, and cultural workers to continue doing what they do best
Channeling non-arts funding streams (public health, housing, transportation, etc.) into artist-led solutions
Marketing and amplifying existing cultural work—not just launching new city-run programs
Austin doesn’t have a creativity shortage—it has a support and sustainability problem
We don’t need more programming—we need the means to keep going
barriers_identified: Lack of integration with non-arts funding streams
Insufficient marketing and amplification of existing work
solutions_proposed: Invest in long-term, affordable space for artists and cultural workers
Channel non-arts funding streams (public health, housing, transportation, etc.) into artist-led solutions
Market and amplify existing cultural work instead of launching new city-run programs
Prioritize creating a stable ecosystem for cultural producers
